doc:
Anita Thompson Dickinson Reynolds https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anita_Thompson_Dickinson_Reynolds 0 Anita Thompson Dickinson Reynolds (1901–1980) was an African American model, dancer, and actress. She was born in Chicago, Illinois, on March 28, 1901, and died in St. Croix, United States Virgin Islands in 1980. She grew up in Los Angeles, California where her mother Beatrice Thompson was active in the NAACP. Her uncle was Noah Thompson whose wife was Eloise Bibb Thompson. She trained as a dancer and performed with Rudolph Valentino. She was an actress in African American cinema. She worked as a nurse in France between the wars and left after the Nazi occupation. Upon her return to the United States, she studied to be a psychologist. Reynolds was also a teacher and art instructor. Her memoirs were published by Harvard University Press in January 2014, based on notes in interviews by Howard Miller and edited by Cornell University professor George Hutchinson. Anita_Thompson_Dickinson_Reynolds ( 1901 – 1980 ) was an_African_American_model , dancer , and actress . She was_born in Chicago , Illinois , on March_28_,_1901 , and died in St._Croix , United_States_Virgin_Islands in 1980 . She grew up in Los_Angeles , California where her_mother_Beatrice_Thompson was active in the_NAACP . Her_uncle was Noah_Thompson whose_wife was Eloise_Bibb_Thompson . She trained as a_dancer and performed with Rudolph_Valentino . She was an_actress in African_American_cinema . She worked as a_nurse in France between the_wars and left after the_Nazi_occupation . Upon her_return to the_United_States , she studied_to_be a_psychologist . Reynolds was also a_teacher_and_art_instructor . Her_memoirs were_published by Harvard_University_Press in January_2014 , based on notes in interviews by Howard_Miller and edited by Cornell_University_professor_George_Hutchinson .
